meanings.definition: A person who tends to overstate or magnify the truth.
meanings.sent1: The exaggerator claimed to have caught a fish as big as a whale.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the office exaggerator because she always makes stories sound more exciting.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerator said he saw a spider the size of a car in his room!
meanings.sent4: Her brother is an exaggerator, turning a small bump into a mountain of trouble.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the exaggerator, for their tales can grow taller than the tallest tree.

meanings.definition: One who exaggerates or embellishes stories or facts.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was known as the exaggerator in his class for his tall tales.
meanings.sent2: As an exaggerator, she always adds a touch of drama to her anecdotes.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerator made the simple picnic seem like a grand adventure.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as an exaggerator made people question the truth in his words.
meanings.sent5: The exaggerator's stories were like colorful paintings, bright and larger than life.
